pillars.title: Data we collect
pillars.copy: Only the essentials—contact details, engagement records, project documentation, and anonymised analytics—necessary to deliver and improve our services.

pillars.title: How we use it
pillars.copy: Information powers account management, service delivery, compliance, and platform optimisation. We never sell personal data.

pillars.title: How we protect it
pillars.copy: Security controls include encryption, access governance, and continuous monitoring aligned with best-practice frameworks.

sections.heading: Scope & eligibility
sections.body: Services are delivered under mutually executed proposals or master agreements. By engaging Digivation, you confirm that you have authority to bind your organisation and will provide accurate information required for delivery.

sections.heading: Acceptable use
sections.body: Clients agree not to misuse infrastructure, tooling, or shared platforms, including unauthorised access attempts, malware distribution, or activity that degrades service for other customers.

sections.heading: Fees & invoicing
sections.body: Fees, billing schedules, and payment terms are defined in the applicable statement of work. Late payments may incur finance charges or suspend services until accounts are rectified.

sections.heading: Intellectual property
sections.body: Deliverables, software, and documentation remain Digivation intellectual property unless transferred in writing. Clients receive usage rights necessary to operate the solution.

sections.heading: Confidentiality
sections.body: Both parties commit to protecting confidential information and using it solely for agreed purposes. Confidentiality obligations survive the term of the engagement.

commitments.title: Our commitment
points: Deliver services with reasonable skill, care, and diligence
Meet agreed timelines where dependencies are fulfilled
Comply with applicable legislation, safety, and data protection requirements
Provide qualified personnel and vetted subcontractors

commitments.title: Your commitment
points: Provide necessary access, information, and decision-making within agreed timeframes
Ensure third-party consents or licences are in place
Use deliverables in accordance with the licence terms
Settle invoices within the payment terms

boilerplate.heading: Limitation of liability
boilerplate.text: Digivation is not liable for indirect, consequential, or punitive damages. Direct liability is capped at the amounts paid under the related services in the preceding 12 months, unless prohibited by law.

boilerplate.heading: Termination
boilerplate.text: Either party may terminate for material breach if not remedied within 30 days of written notice. Termination does not relieve payment obligations for work already completed.

boilerplate.heading: Governing law
boilerplate.text: These terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of South Africa. Any disputes will be handled by the courts of Johannesburg, subject to alternative dispute mechanisms agreed in writing.
